1.c: Distance from center of city. Transportation inadequate.
1.b: Zoned for residences. Moderately restricted.

areaDesc.5: This is partially developed outlying section containing about 20 houses ranging in price from $5,000 to $10,000.

6.1: Country Club Part 5, Coral Gables, Florida

1.c: None
1.b: Zoned for residences, highly restricted, close to good bus transportation, schools and downtown Miami business section.

6.1: Brickell Ave. District, Miami

1.c: None
1.b: Zoned for single family residences except on S.W. 3rd Ave. where multi-family residences are permitted, moderately restricted, bus transportation ample, schools, churches and shopping centers easily accessible.

2.a: Semi-executives, professional men & high class clerks

areaDesc.5: This is the most rapidly developing section in Metropolitan Miami. There is a small percentage of these houses that are speculatively built and are available for rent but the percentage of this type to the other is so small that it is not given consideration in the above analysis.

6.1: Brickell Estates- New Shenandoah Miami, Florida

1.c: Lack of zoning and building restrictions
1.b: Close to good bus transportation, community shopping centers, schools and golf courses

areaDesc.5: This is a small area with a few 1-story frame and C B S houses, ranging from $2,000 to $3,500 in value, renting from $20 to $35.

6.1: Kirkland Heights, Miami, Fla.

1.c: Sparsely developed. Distance from center of City. Lack of pride in home ownership. Distance from community business centers, schools, churches and recreational centers. Inadequate zoning and restrictions.
1.b: Location of Naval Reserve unit in area

areaDesc.5: This is an unsuccessful boom-time development containing about 40 or 50 1-story houses (5-6 rooms), ranging in value from $1500 to $3500, and is a rental rather than a home owned area.

6.1: Northwestern portion of Opalocka, Florida

1.c: Distance from center of city, inadequate zoning and restrictions, proximity of Hialeah Race Track, Seaboard Railroad shops, and Municipal Airport. Lack of pride of home ownership.
1.b: Close to occupant sources of employment, schools, churches and Hialeah business center.

areaDesc.5: This is a sparsely developed outlying territory, the Southern portion of which is improved with a few 2-story houses worth about $4,000, while the Northern portion is improved with 1-story singles ranging in values from $1,000 to $2,500. The area has witnessed practically no new residential construction since the depression.

6.1: Southeastern portion of Hialeah, Florida

1.c: Poor restrictions and zoning. Proximity of incinerator.
1.b: Close to good schools, transportation and community shopping centers.

6.1: Allapattah Park & surroundings Miami, Florida

1.c: None
1.b: Zoned for residences. Moderate restrictions. Close to good transportation, schools, community shopping centers.

areaDesc.5: This is a boom-time subdivision. It contains approximately 30 houses, mostly built during boom, having value today of between $3500 and $5500, majority of which are occupied by tenants. Rental range of $35 to $45 a month, for which there is a good demand.

6.1: Auburndale, Miami, Florida

1.c: None
1.b: Zoned for residential and moderately restricted. Close to good bus transportation, schools and community shopping centers.

6.1: Natoma Manors, Miami, Florida

1.c: Close to Negro segregation.
1.b: Close to good transportatioi. Zoned for residences and moderately restricted.

6.1: Older portion of Coconut Grove, Miami, Florida

1.c: In that portion lying east of Biscayne Blvd. there are a number of old, obsolete 1 & 2 story dwellings, some business enterprises, and in that portion west of the Blvd. there is the further detrimental influence of the F.E.C. Railway.
1.b: Zoned for residences and restrictions fairly well enforced. Close to good bus transportation, community shopping centers, grade and high schools.

2.a: Retired capitalists semi-executives, clerks, skilled mechanics

areaDesc.5: The west portion of this area is quite uniform. The east portion is spotted, ranging from very desirable dwellings along the Bay to some that are quite undesirable close to the Blvd.

6.1: Little River Section including Baywood & Morningside Miami, Florida

1.c: None
1.b: Zoned for residential and highly restricted.
1.a: Level, filled in land and bulkhead.

areaDesc.5: These islands are very favorably and desirably located, close to bathing beaches, highly restricted. This is a distinctly desirable area and is set apart from the rest of the community. La Gorce Island has just commenced to show activity the last 2 or 3 years, during which time some very beautiful and desirable homes have been erected. About 40 homes in these islands, ranging from $12,000 to $35,000. Approximately one half of the owners of these properties are winter residents.

6.1: La Gorce and Allison Islands, Miami Beach, Florida

1.c: None
1.b: Close to good transportation (bus), community shopping centers, bathing beaches, moderately restricted.

6.1: Miami Beach, Florida

1.c: Distance from Miami. This is a rather outlying development which depends on Miami people to populate it. Distance from schools and churches.
1.b: Close to bathing beach, adequate bus transportation, community shopping centers.
1.a: Level, filled in land; bulkheading completed around Isle.

areaDesc.5: This is a boom-time development which remained static for a number of years, but since 1935 it has experienced considerable growth, probably five times as many houses have been built there in the last two years than were built at any time during the entire previous period of development. Approximately 60 houses, some apartments and community stores; price range of houses from $5,000 to $7,500.

6.1: Normandy Isle, Miami Beach, Fla.

1.c: On account of the moderate restrictions, this part of Miami Beach will not be as desirable for expensive estates and high class residential as some of the other sections of the beach.
1.b: Close to good transportation (bus), community shopping centers, bathing beaches, moderately restricted.

areaDesc.5: This is a very sparsely developed section with 2 or 3 groups of attravtive villas and residences on the ocean side of the area.

6.1: Area just north of Surfside, Florida

1.c: Rather low land and the shore line is not bulkhead
1.b: Close to public bathing beaches, community business centers and adequate bus transprtation; zoned for residential, moderately restricted.

areaDesc.5: This is a new subdivision and contains about 30 houses in the $5000 to $7000 price class, all of which have been constructed in the last three years, majority of which are occupied by home owners.

6.1: Surfside, Florida

1.c: Inadequate bus transportation
1.b: Zoned for residences and well restricted. Close to community shopping centers, golf courses. No bonded debt. Low taxes.

areaDesc.5: This is a boom-time development owned by the Curtiss-Wright interests and incorporated as a seperate municipality. It has no bonded debt and it is a well managed subdivision. Only respectable families are admitted. There are about 50 houses in this area, all of which have been built in the last three years, principally thriough FHA Title II financing.

6.1: Miami Springs, Florida

1.c: Close to Negro settlement.
1.b: Close to good bus transportation, shopping centers and schools.

areaDesc.5: Partially settled section of small single family dwellings ranging in price from $3,000 to $4,500 with a rental range from $25 to $40. These houses are a majority owner occuped and area fairly well maintained considering the neighborhood.

6.1: 17th Avenue Manors, Miami, Florida

1.c: Sparsely settled, close to Biscayne Kennel Club. Unrestricted. No streets, no sidewalks, no utilities.
1.b: None

areaDesc.5: A few houses in this area are 1-story frame construction of poor quality, ranging in price from $500 to $1,000, with a rental range frm $5 to $12. This is a most undesirable area.

6.1: Area immediately West of Western portion of Miami Shores, in an unincorporated community

1.c: The adjacent properties on the west are sparsely built up with non-descript type of buildings occuped by an unstable type.
1.b: Zoned for residences with moderately well enforced restrictions. Close to good grade school and Little River business section. Fair bus transportation.

areaDesc.5: The above remarks under detrimental influences pertain exclusively to the portion of this area lying to the west of Miami Avenue, that portion lying south of Miami Shores is a section containing a very substantial and desirable type of 1 & 2 story single family dwellings. The entire area, however, is less than 20% improved. Price range on those houses is from $1,500 to $6,000.

6.1: Outlying western & southern portion of Miami Shores, Florida

1.c: None
1.b: Highly restricted residential area, incorporated as Miami Shores, zoned for residential, growth is slow, but type of construction and inhabitant is of very high type. Adequate recreational centers, golf course now under construction, good bus transportation, schools, streets adequately landscaped and maintained.

areaDesc.5: Peak sales prices occured in July of 1937

6.1: Miami Shores, Florida

1.c: On account of the moderate restrictions, this part of Miami Beach will not be as desireable for expensive estates and high class residential as some of the other sections of the beach.
1.b: Close to good transportation (bus), community shopping centers, bathing beaches. moderately restricted.

areaDesc.5: This is a very spotted section and buildings that do exist range from attractive villas on the ocean side to 2 story singles, garage apartments, and apartment buildings in the eastern portion.

6.1: Area just south of Surfside, Fla.

1.c: None
1.b: Zoned for residential, moderately restricted, close to schools, churches, playgrounds, adequate bus transportation, community business centers in the vicinity are easily accessible.

areaDesc.5: In the eastern portion of the area the type of occupant and homeowner is of considerably higher class than in the remainder of the area, therefore the wide variation in the annual income.

6.1: Biltmore Section, Miami, Florida

1.c: None from Negro standpoint
1.b: Close to transportation and stores

areaDesc.5: This is a small Southwest downtown Negro area.

6.1: Negro area South of 8th Street between 4th & 8th Avenue, Miami, Florida

1.c: Lack of conformity of some of the older houses with the new houses constructed recently in this area.
1.b: Zoned for residential and moderately restricted; close to good bus transportation along 7th Avenue, also near community shopping centers, churches, playgrounds and recreational centers.

6.1: Area adjacent to Moore Park on the north, Miami, Florida

1.c: Encroachment of business and area being somewhat blighted from the standpoint of good residential area.
1.b: Zoned for residences, apartments and small business. Restrictions moderately well maintained. Close to shopping centers and schools. Good bus transportation. Large part within walking distance of downtown Miami.

2.a: Professional men, business executives, clerks, and mechanics

areaDesc.5: This section, particularly along the Bay and East of Brickell, is still quite desirable property, and some of the older residents of the City maintain their homes there. That portion West of Brickell is developed with one-story frames homes in the majority of cases, and its desirability is rapidly depreciating. Some of the finer homes are now being used for tourist homes, tea rooms and boarding houses.\

6.1: Part of Brickell Subdivision, Miami, Florida

1.c: None.
1.b: Zoned for residential, highly restricted, good transportation facilities near city center.

areaDesc.5: The subdivision, particularly that portion fronting the water, is a very desirable development and is fully developed; houses on the interior streets are not as desirable or as attractive as those on the water front, but the whole area is well maintained, attractive and holds its value very well.

6.1: Point View, Miami, Florida

1.c: Proximity to small negro concentration.
1.b: Zoned for residential and just moderately restricted, close to bus transportation and city center.

6.1: Holleman Park; South S W Section of city, Miami, Florida

1.c: Heterogeneous type of improvements. Encroachment of business and apartments and tourist homes and boat yards.
1.b: Close to adequate bus transportation, community and downtown Miami shopping centers. Zoned for residences, apartments, and small community business.

2.a: Skilled and semi-skilled mchanics, clerks & business men

areaDesc.5: This takes in the older and formerly better sections of the City of Miami proper, but as new subdivisions are being developed desireability of this area has proportionately suffered. This is a good rental area from an investment standpoint, being close in to the City. *Rentals of these apartments will average from $40 to $60 a month in the winter season, and from $2 to $4 for the hotel rooms. During the off summer season, rents will range from $15 to $30.

6.1: South of Flagler from River to S.W. 22nd Ave. & South of Flagler to 15th Street, Miami, Florida

1.c: Lack of adequate restrictions. Poor type and design of homes of inferior class.
1.b: Close to shopping center

areaDesc.5: The Eastern portion of this area is well built up, that is that portion East of 7th Avenue. Most of the remaining part of the area contains few houses, the majority of which are small undesirable frame cottages, ranging in price from $700 to $1200 and renting from $ to $15 per month. There have been a few new houses of this type constructed in the last few years.

6.1: Little River Section North and South of 79th St., from N.E. 4th Ave. to N.W. 24th Ave. Only extreme Southeastern portion in City of Miami, remainder in unincorporated area.

1.c: None
1.b: Zoned for residential, moderately restricted, close to transportation, high school and community shopping centers.

6.1: Beacon Manors and surrounding area, Miami, Florida

1.c: None from Negro standpoint.
1.b: Close to school, bus transportation and community shopping center.

areaDesc.5: * $1,000,000 low cost negro housing project now supervised by United States housing authority is located in this area. It contains 243 units consisting principally of 2, 3, 4 and 5 room apartments, which rent for $1.24 per room per week including water, but not light or fuel for cooking. The project at present is 96% occupied, the 4% vacancy being due principally to seasonal influence plus the further fact that most of the vacancy is in the largest type unit.

6.1: Liberty City, Miami, Florida

1.c: Lack of adequate building restrictions. Variety in type of construction and design.
1.b: Close to good bus transportation, grade and high schools and community shopping centers.

6.1: South of 62nd Street from N.W. 17th Ave, ti N.E. 4th Ct., Miami, Florida

1.c: Inadequate streets, utlilties, transportation and restrictions. Proximity to Miami Zoo.
1.b: Close to school and community business center

areaDesc.5: This is a nondescript boom-time neighborhood which has experience little or no improvement during the last ten years. Houses range in price from $1,000 to $2,000. Rentals from $10 to $15. Very ordinary neighborhoo

6.1: North Miami, Florida

1.c: Outlying section sparsely built up- North Miami Zoo
1.b: Zoned for residences, close to community shopping centers. Post Office and close to grade school.

areaDesc.5: This is a sparsely settled outlying section where building restrictions are poorly maintained. Rentals range from $10 to $25 per month. The area is approximately 50 houses ranging in price from $1,000 to $5,000. On account of the location sales are slow and rentals low. This is a spotted area and could almost be called "high yellow".

6.1: Western Section- Biscayne Park North Miami, Florida

1.c: Close to Hialeah race track. Unstable grade of population. Many transients. High per capita debt. Difficulty of collecting rents.
1.b: Close to schools, shopping centers, bus transportation

2.a: Skilled mechanics, laborers, race track workers & gamblers

areaDesc.5: This area surrounding Hialeah race track, which is in operation only during 60 days of the winter season. Contains a very low percentage of home ownership and as a rule the inhabitants of this area belong to the low grade white population. The majority of the houses in the area are 1-story frame and C.B.S., 4-6 room bungalows, ranging in value from $400 to $1,500.

6.1: Area surrounding Hialeah race Track, Hialeah, Florida

1.c: Lack of zoning restrictions, transportation, schools, stores, churches. Close to dump and Negro area.
1.b: None

areaDesc.5: This is a sparsely settled outlying area, wherein is located many small truck gardens growing winter vegetables and flowers. It is a typical rural community in every respect.

6.1: White Belt area in an unincorporated community

1.c: Lack of adequate zoning restrictions in majority of the area, poorly improved streets, lack of utilities.
1.b: Close to good transportation and community shopping centers.

2.a: Clerks, mechanics, small merchants, a few professional men

6.1: Majority in Northwest portion of City of Miami, Florida

1.c: Poor enforcement of zoning restrictions.
1.b: Zoned for residences. Close to good transportation and schools and shopping centers.

areaDesc.5: Like many other areas in this city, there is some small portion of it being improved with houses too good for the area.

6.1: North of N.W. 36th Street between N. Miami Ave. and 12th Ave., Miami, Florida

1.c: Lack of zoning restrictions. Close to undesirable areas.
1.b: Close to good bus transportation, schools and shopping centers

areaDesc.5: This is an area of mostly 1-story 1-family dwellings, price range from $1500 to $3500, rental range of $15 to $35. In the area just North of the Miami canal and East of 27th Avenue, a few attractive small homes have recetly been constructed, which are entitled to a better grade rating than the remainder of the area.

6.1: Musa Isles & Allapattah Section, Miami, Florida

1.c: None from Negro standpoint
1.b: Close to schools, churches and shopping centers

areaDesc.5: This is a downtown Negro area, practically 100% built up, repairs in poor condition, many of the houses should be condemned and destroyed.

6.1: Downtown Northwest Section, Negro Area, Miami, Florida

1.c: None
1.b: Zoned for residential, well restricted, good bus transportation, close to schools, churches, recreational centers, parks, playgrounds and community centers.

areaDesc.5: This little area is very attractively landscaped, maintained and restricted, slightly elevated and commands a nice view of the river and in it live some substantial homeowners.

6.1: Grove Park, Miami, Florida

1.c: Spotted with a heterogeneous type of improvement and cheap type of construction in many homes in the area. Poor repair conditions of many properties and encroachment of rooming and boarding houses in extreme Eastern portion of area.
1.b: Close to good bus transportation, shopping centers, schools and churches and parks, and playgrounds.

areaDesc.5: This is a wide area and practically the same influences are present in all sections of it. It is a section where most of the construction is old-rundown, and is held by owners for investments rather than for personal occupancy.

6.1: North of Flagler down by River on the East and North, and by 32nd Avenue on the West. Also including an area south of Flagler to 8th Street between 27th & 32nd Avenues, Miami, Florida

1.c: Close to West Flagler Kennel Club, cemeteries, poor zoning and restrictions. Poor type and design of construction.
1.b: Close to good transportation, community shopping centers.

2.a: Clerks, mechanics, small mechants & truck farmers

areaDesc.5: This is a sparsely settled outlying area with values running from $1500 to $3500, rentals from $10 to $35. Nothing very favorable can be said about the area.

6.1: Section lying mostly North of West Flagler from 32nd Ave. to Red Road, Miami, Florida

1.c: None
1.b: Zoned for single family and multi-family residences, moderately restricted, close to good bus transportation, community shopping centers, churches and schools

areaDesc.5: There is a small percentage of these houses that are speculatively built and are available for rent but the percentage of this type to the other is so small that it is not given consideration in the above analysis.

6.1: Newly developed portion of Old Shenandoah and immediately adjacent property, Miami, Florida

1.c: None
1.b: Zoned for residential, moderately restricted, close to bus transportation, community business centers, high school

areaDesc.5: This area embraces Old Shenandoah and a portion of the new development. Old Shenandoah is practically 100% built up but its desirability as a residential section is on the decline.

6.1: Old Shenandoah, and a major portion between S W 13th and 25th Avenue and 8th Street and the Florida East Coast RR Miami, Florida

1.c: None
1.b: Zoned for residential, moderately restricted, close to bus transportation, community shopping centers, high school

2.a: Professional, business men and retired capitalists

6.1: Silver Bluff Section, Miami, Florida

1.c: Distance from schools and community shopping centers.
1.b: Zoned for residences. Moderately restricted. Close to adequate bus transportation.

areaDesc.5: This area has had some new construction of small bungalows during the last 3 years, houses being built by a local builder for speculative purposes. The builder has been fairly successful in disposing of these houses, and the community is desirable for home seekers of moderate means.

6.1: Silver Buff Estates and King's Park, Miami, Florida

1.c: Variety of type of construction and architectural design. Close to Negro segregation, and lack of proper restrictions and zoning.
1.b: Close to good bus transportation

6.1: Older portion of Coconut Grove, Miami, Florida

1.c: Lack of price restrictions in building.
1.b: Close to good transportation and community shopping center and schools.

areaDesc.5: This section is varying in its type of construction. It is close to some poor "D" areas on the West, abuts some fairly good "B" areas on the East.

6.1: Area lying West of Shenandoah, Miami, Florida

1.c: Poor restrictions. Lack of paved streets. Variety of type of architecture and construction.
1.b: Zoned for residences. Close to schools and community shopping centers. Bus transportation along Coral Way,

areaDesc.5: This is new developed area with majority of houses in same built for sale, and ranging in sales price from $4500 to $5500.

6.1: S.W. 27th to 32nd Avenues between 19th and 22nd Streets Miami, Florida

1.c: Proximity to railroad. Lack of proper zoning. Poor construction and design. Distance from shopping centers.
1.b: Close to bus transportation

areaDesc.5: This is a sparsely improved section between good areas of Miami and Coral Gables, ranging in value from $1,500 to $2,500, and renting from $15 to $30 a month.

6.1: Southwest section of Miami between 27th and 26th Avenues, Miami, Florida

1.c: None from Negro standpoint
1.b: Close to schools, churches, shopping centers, bus transportation

areaDesc.5: This is the Coconut Grove Negro section of Miami.

6.1: Coconut Grove, Miami, Florida

1.c: None
1.b: Zoned for residential and medium well restricted. Close to adequate bus transportation, schools, churches and recreational centers, and community shopping centers.

areaDesc.5: The central Western portion of this area is partially developed and consists of several new subdivisions which are enjoying considerable new residential construction in the $4,000 to $7,000 price class.

6.1: Coconut Grove Section, Miami, Florida

1.c: None
1.b: Zoned for residences and highly restricted. This is a section located on both banks of the Cloral Gables Canal and on account of the waterway, docking facilities and high elevation of the terrain it is highly desirable and several very fine homes have recently been built on the banks of the canal.

areaDesc.5: All homes are owner built, there are no rentals and none are on the market. There are approximately 10 houses ranginf in price from $12,000 to 25,000

6.1: Coral Gables, Extreme Southern Sec. Coral Gables, Florida

1.c: None
1.b: Zoned for residential and moderately restricted. Close to good bus transportation and Coral Gables community shopping center

areaDesc.5: In recent years there have been several large 2-story houses built in this area.

6.1: Riviera; Coconut Grove; Country Club 6 Section, Coral gables, Florida

1.c: None
1.b: Zoned for single family residences and moderately restricted. Close to good bus transportation.

2.a: Business executives, professional men & high type clerks

areaDesc.5: This includes the largest and best developed section of Coral Gables

6.1: South Central portion Coral Gables Coral Gables, Florida

1.c: None
1.b: Zoned for residences and moderately restricted. Close to good bus transporation and community shopping centers.

areaDesc.5: Glen Gables, which runs from Southwest 11th Street to 15th Street, and 42nd Place to 47th Avenue, is not in the corporate limits of Coral Gables.

6.1: Granada, Section A, B, & C of Coral Gables, Florida

1.c: Tourist and trailer camps in the area, particularly along the South side of Southwest 8th Street.
1.b: Close to the community shopping centers of Coral Gables. Close to good transportation and schools.

areaDesc.5: In this section practically all the improvements have been of recent origin, having been made in the last 2 or 3 years. They consist of 1-family C B S bungalows and about 50% have been built by individuals for home ownership, adnf the other 50% by speculative builders. The majority of the houses are occupied.

6.1: Tamiami Trail Park, Tamiami Groves and Granada Groves, not in an incorporated community

1.c: Increast of tourist homes and boarding houses within the area.
1.b: Zoned for residences. Highly restricted. Close to good bus transportation, community shopping centers, schools and churches

2.a: Executives, semi-executives, business men & retired capitalists

k.1: Good from investment standpoint & fair from home ownership standpoint

areaDesc.5: *The hotels and apartments have very few rentals during the summer months. During the winter tourist sesson they create practically 100% occupancy. Prices for apartments range from $300 to  800 for the season, hotel rooms from $4 to $10 a day.

6.1: Buena Vista Section South to & including Miramar, Miami, Florida

A3.name: Bay Shore and Bay Shore Plaza

1.c: None
1.b: Zoned for residential, highly restricted, close to adequate bus transportation and reasonably so to schools, churches and community stores.

6.1: Bay Shore and Bay Shore Plaza Miami, Florida

1.c: The F.E.C. Railway parallels the west boundary of this Bayshore Subdivision which tends to detract from the desirability of it.
1.b: Close to good bus transportation, close to schools and community shopping centers.

areaDesc.5: This area is seperated from %-4 by the main line of the F.E.C. Railway and there is a violent break in the type of construction and occupants in the two areas.

6.1: Bayshore- west of Biscayne Blvd. Miami, Florida

1.c: Encroachment of business.
1.b: Zoned for residences. Moderately restricted. Close to good bus transportation, community shopping centers, schools and churches.

areaDesc.5: This is old area containing mixture of improvements.

6.1: Lemon City Section, Miami, Florida

1.c: None
1.b: Zoned for residential, well restricted, close to good bus transportation, reasonably accessible to grammar and high schools, churches and business centers close to area. Dockage facilities for small boats available.

6.1: Shore Crest & Belle Meade, Miami, Florida

1.c: Poorly zoned and nondescript type of dwellings.
1.b: Close to good transportation, schools and community shopping centers

areaDesc.5: There are few dwellings constructed in this area, most of which are the cheaper and less desirable type. Streets are poorly paved. No landscaping. The area in general is nondescript and unattractive. Rentals range from $12 to $20 a month. Values from $1,500 to $3,500. That portion of this area West of N.W. 7th Ave. is located in Seventh Avenue Park, in which it is contemplated approximately 300 houses will be erected, all financed under 90% FHA loans and all selling for less than $2,600. 50 of these houses have already been erected and the majority sold.

6.1: Residential area West of North Miami Ave. in the vicinity of Edison School Miami, Florida

1.c: FEC Railroad parallels the area on the East boundary.
1.b: Close to schools and shopping centers. Good bus transportation and complete community business center.

areaDesc.5: Along Northeast 3rd Avenue and 3rd Court, and the Eastern portion of 82nd Terrace, there is a better grade and type of property than in the remainder of the area. In this subarea the property could almost be classified as B-grade.

6.1: Residential area North of Little River business section Miami, Florida

1.c: Street improperly graded in places, waterways poorly maintained.
1.b: Close to the schools, good bus transportation, churches and community shopping centers. Zoned for residences, restrictions moderately well enforced.

areaDesc.5: Approximately 150 houses in this area ranging in price from $2,000 to $8,000. Some of the hosues are old, obsolete frame dwellings intermingled with new construction of latest design. Majority of the homes are owner occuped and area is not shown which includes the new construction except along one or two of the best highways.

6.1: Between Shorecrest & Miami Shores: Portion in Miami Shores, Fla. & portion in unincorporated community.

1.c: Distances from schools. Absence of zoning restrictions. Proximity of FEC Railroad.
1.b: Close to good bus transportation and community shopping centers

areaDesc.5: This area contains a heterogeneous mixture of all kinds of property.

6.1: Both sides of N.E 6th Avenue & Biscayne Blvd. from 83rd Terr. to 91st Terr., Miami, Florida

1.c: Encroachment of business.
1.b: Close to transportation, theaters and business district

areaDesc.5: This is oldest area of Miami Beach and it is located close to various night clubs, theaters, public bathing beaches and dog tracks.

6.1: Southern tip of Miami Beach, Florida

1.c: Certain streets are zoned for and restricted to hotels and apartments with some few commercial buildings, encroachment of business. Influx of Jewish race into area.
1.b: Near business area, parks, golf courses, recreational centers, bathing beaches, good transportation facilities; zoned for residential

2.a: Winter residents, executives, business and miscellaneous nondescript

b.2: Apartment & hotels reinforced concrete, hollow tile, C B S

areaDesc.5: *Rentals here are confined exclusively to the tourist winter season when many homes are vacated by the owner and rented furnished; prices ranging from $750 to $3000 for the season. **Apartment and hotel rooms vary greatly as to rental price during the off summer season- rooms can be had for as little as $2.50 a week and apartments for $15; the prices of these same units during the winter season will increase 400 or 500%

6.1: 8th to Dade Boulevard, Miami Beach, Florida

1.c: Subject to occasional wind and water damage from storms. Sanitorium located in area.
1.b: Zoned for residential and moderately restricted; readily accessible to Miami and Miami Beach business centers; desirable water front property.
1.a: Level filled in land; oldest island in group.

6.1: Belle Isle, Miami Beach, Florida

1.c: Property on these Islands is subject to occasional high winds and water.
1.b: Zoned for residences and highly restricted, Hibiscus, Palm & Star Islands have 10 bus or street care fare and San Marco, San Marino DiLido, Rivo Alto have 15 jitney fare. Transportation of this kind is used practically exclusively by the servants and help employed by the residents of the Islands.
1.a: Level- This is all filled in land- properly and adequately bulkheaded.

areaDesc.5: *A number of the houses are locally owned and aer vacated by their owners during the winter season and rented furnishes, rentals ranging from $600 to $3000 for the season.

6.1: San Marco, San Marino, DiLido, Rivo Alto, Hibiscus, Palm & Star Islands, Miami Beach, Florida

1.c: No destrimental influences
1.b: This area includes the second most desirable and exclusive Miami Beach residences, close to good bus transportation, parks and playgrounds. Close to private and public bathing beaches, community shopping centers, theatres, night clubs; Ideal private docking facilities are connected with many of the larger estates along the various waterways.

areaDesc.5: *A number of the houses are locally owned and are vacated by their owners during the Winter season and rented furnishes, rentals ranging from $1500 to $5000 for the season.

6.1: Dade Blvd. to LaGorce Island Sunset Islands- Miami Beach, Fla.

1.c: None
1.b: This is the most exclusive and desirable ocean front property in Miami Beach. Here are located some of the finest estates. It is close to bus transportation, zoned for residences and highly restricted.

6.1: 42 to 63 Sts., Miami Beach, Fla.
